articles.title: Swiss President on Relationship with DPRK
articles.content:
Swiss President on Relationship with DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Han Tae Song, DPRK ambassador to Switzerland, presented his credentials to the president of the Swiss Confederation on March 28.
					 The president hoped that everything would go well in the DPRK in the future, too, noting that it has made a lot of achievements in the economic construction and the work for improvement of people's livelihood.
					
					 Turning to the history of relations between the two countries, the president hoped that the situation on the Korean peninsula would be eased as early as possible.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Developing Education
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Developing Education
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The DPRK enforces the universal 12-year compulsory education on a full scale this year.
					 In this regard, Rodong Sinmun in an editorial Sunday stresses that the education of the rising generations is a very important work decisive of the nation's destiny.
					
					 Education should be steadily improved and the rising generations be trained into genuine revolutionaries and reliable pillars of the country in order to achieve the prosperity of the country and the nation and carry forward to completion the revolutionary cause of Juche, the revolutionary cause of Songun, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) unfolded a grand blueprint for developing the overall education and turning the DPRK into a country of education and talents and has wisely led the work for its materialization.
					
					 The historic 7th WPK Congress clearly indicated the orientation and ways for preparing the new generations politically and ideologically, training them as versatile talents possessed of high creativity, noble virtue and stalwart physical strength and making all the working people contribute to the prosperity of the country through life-long learning.
					
					 Thanks to the wise leadership of the Party which ushered in a great heyday for developing the Juche-oriented education, a broad avenue was opened for the DPRK to catch up with the education level of developed countries at Mallima speed and push forward the building of a power of talents.
					
					 Immensely rosy is the future of the country guided by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un who set this year as a year of science and education and gives energetic guidance so that the country can emerge victorious in bringing about a radical development in education in the new century with main emphasis put on building a power of talents.

articles.title: Keeping Peace Is Korean Nation's Vital Task: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Keeping Peace Is Korean Nation's Vital Task: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The present grim situation on the Korean peninsula urges the Korean nation to intensify the struggle to prevent a war and defend peace, Rodong Sinmun Sunday stresses in an article.
					 The touch-and-go situation in which a war may break out anytime is prevailing on the Korean peninsula, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 If a war breaks out on this land, it will readily spill over into a nuclear war inflicting unimaginable damage on the Korean nation.
					
					 The largest-ever joint military exercises targeting the DPRK, staged by the U.S. and its puppet warlike forces this time, clearly augur this.
					
					 All the nuclear strategic assets of the U.S. imperialists, including nuclear carrier, nuclear submarine and nuclear strategic bomber, have been involved in the military exercises.
					
					 South Korea with a lot of the U.S. weapons of mass destruction is now little short of a nuclear arsenal which can go off any moment.
					
					 The reckless nuclear war hysteria of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces has already gone to the extremes and such foolish acts turn the Korean peninsula into the world's biggest hotbed with a high possibility of military conflict by irritating even the surrounding countries.
					
					 When the crow flies, her tail follows.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the daily-growing danger of a nuclear war attributable to the frantic saber-rattling targeting the DPRK will spell a catastrophic disaster in the long run.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams U.S., S. Korean Authorities Clinging to "Special Operation"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams U.S., S. Korean Authorities Clinging to "Special Operation"
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The U.S. who is at a loss what to do in putting more pressure upon the DPRK is clinging to a "special operation".
					 In this regard, Minju Joson on Sunday says in a commentary:
					
					 It is very similar to the terrorist act committed by Hitler as a last resort occasioned by the summit of the Allied Powers in Teheran after finding himself in the abyss of ruin during World War II.
					
					 History showed that no matter how desperately the enemies of humankind and peace may try, they can never escape from the destiny of ruin.
					
					 It is a wild dream for the U.S. to try to tar the supreme dignity of the DPRK and its sovereignty because the powerful revolutionary Paektusan army regarding it as its life and soul to defend the leader unto death stands guard over this land and forms a bulwark and shield around the headquarter of the revolution.
					
					 Moreover, "special operation" and "preemptive attack" are not monopoly of the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK has already warned that it is ready for any forms of war the U.S. wishes.
					
					 The DPRK has its own style strategy for special operation and preemptive attack, and the armed forces and hardware to be involved are on a highly alert.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean puppet forces would be well advised not to be indifferent to the warning of the spokesman of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army but to exercise prudence thinking twice about the catastrophic results to be caused by their anti-DPRK military moves.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Foreign Minister's Wrong Behavior Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Foreign Minister's Wrong Behavior Flailed
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Yun Pyong Se, puppet foreign minister of south Korea, at a "meeting of foreign ministers of coalition countries" in the U.S. some days ago, solicited for "strengthened alliance" and "sanctions on the north" when he met the state secretary and the chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee of the House of Representatives of the U.S.
					 Commenting on the fact, Rodong Sinmun Sunday brands this as a spasmodic symptom of a "mentally deranged" keen on maintaining the policy for confrontation with the fellow countrymen and prolonging his dirty remaining days with the backing of the outsider.
					
					 Such deed is related to the deplorable plight of the puppet conservative forces, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The miserable end of the Park Geun Hye regime put at stake the fate of the riff-raffs of the conservative authorities who served the old demon as her cat's paws.
					
					 The henchmen of traitor Park, much upset, are clinging close to the armpit of their American master, getting all the more zealous in escalating confrontation with the DPRK in their desperate bid to get rid of the abyss of ruin.
					
					 It is exactly for this reason that Yun visited his American masters and blustered that the chaotic political situation in south Korea will have "no impact on cooperation" with the U.S. and pledged to "share fate with the U.S. at time of difficulty".
					
					 Sealed is the fate of Yun staking his fate on dependence on the outsider.
					
					 No desperate efforts will be able to save the group of traitors including Yun.

articles.title: Prosecution's Proper Investigation Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Prosecution's Proper Investigation Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- CBS of south Korea demanded that the prosecution take a fair probe into U Pyong U, former chief secretary for civil administration of Chongwadae, in connection with the Park Geun Hye-Choe Sun Sil scandal.
					 The prosecution should bring U to justice by disclosing all the charges brought against him, it stressed.

articles.title: S. Korea: Police Condemned for Arresting Progressive Activist
articles.content:
S. Korea: Police Condemned for Arresting Progressive Activist
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The People's Emergency Action for Forcing the Park Geun Hye Regime to Step Down held a press conference outside the Jongro police station in Seoul on March 29, said the south Korean internet paper No-cut News.
					 According to it, the organization denounced the police for arresting an activist of civic organization who took part in the struggle against the import of American beef into south Korea.

articles.title: Korean Books Donated to Russia
articles.content:
Korean Books Donated to Russia
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of donating Korean books was held at the Amur Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on Mar. 27 ahead of the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On display at its venue were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and books showing the achievements made by the Korean army and people.
					
					 Attending the ceremony were the first secretary of the Amur Regional Committee, the chairman of the Blagobeshensk Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the chief of the Tynda Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and other personages of Russia and the DPRK consul to Khabarovsk.
					
					 The books were conveyed to the first secretary of the Amur Regional Committee.
					
					 Noting that they are pleased to receive those books on the occasion of Kim Il Sung's birth anniversary, the first secretary said:
					
					 We always remember the great exploits performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the development of the Russia-DPRK friendly relations.
					
					 Those Korean books serve as a valuable textbook for us who are eager to know about the DPRK and support the Korean people's just cause.
					
					 We wish the Korean people bigger success in the struggle to build a socialist power under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 We will make positive contribution to the development of relations between the two countries and the two parties by actively organizing celebrations events for the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: 105th Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
105th Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung to Be Marked in Russia
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed by the Communist Party "Russian Communists" on March 20.
					 M. A. Suraikin, chairman of the Central Committee of the Party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of the President on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, his birth anniversary.

articles.title: 105th Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung to Be Marked in UK
articles.content:
105th Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung to Be Marked in UK
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- A British preparatory committee for celebrating the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed in the joint name of the New Communist Party of Britain, the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK on March 24.
					 Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold diverse political and cultural events, including celebration meeting and seminar on the exploits of the President, on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, his birth anniversary.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Germany
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Germany
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed by the Communist Party of Germany on March 28.
					 Torsten Schoevitz, chairman of the Party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of the President on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, his birth anniversary.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Denmark
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Denmark
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed in Denmark on March 27.
					 H. Jacobsen, member of the Leadership of the Communist Party in Denmark, and Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, were elected co-chairmen of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold diverse political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary career and exploits of the President.
